tool_description: Audits data stores to identify and classify cardholder data, sensitive authentication data, and other protected information according to PCI DSS data classification requirements.

data_sources.description: List of data source identifiers to audit (databases, file systems, etc.).

scan_patterns.description: Data patterns to search for (PAN, CVV, expiry-date, cardholder-name, etc.).

include_encrypted.description: Whether to attempt classification of encrypted data stores.

sampling_percentage.description: Percentage of data to sample for classification (1-100).

error_messages: Empty data sources: Provide at least one data source in the data_sources array.
Invalid scan patterns: Provide valid data classification patterns like 'PAN', 'CVV', 'expiry-date'.
Data source access denied: Unable to access one or more specified data sources due to permission issues.
Invalid sampling percentage: sampling_percentage must be between 1 and 100.
Data source connection failed: Unable to establish connection to one or more data sources.
usage: Provide array of data sources to audit and specify the types of sensitive data patterns to search for. Optionally configure encrypted data scanning and sampling percentage. The tool classifies data according to PCI DSS data categories.

total_records_scanned.description: Total number of data records examined during the audit

cardholder_data_found.description: Number of records containing cardholder data

sensitive_auth_data_found.description: Number of records containing sensitive authentication data

data_locations.description: List of locations where sensitive data was discovered

classification_summary.description: Summary of data classification findings and recommendations

audit_timestamp.description: Timestamp when the audit was completed
